website_summaries.verdict: The Shure SE215 Wireless earphones offers some of the best in-ear Bluetooth audio performance available under $200.
pros: Super-secure in-ear fit, with some passive noise reduction

customer_reviews.title: ***Very poor Bluetooth implementation ruins these***
customer_reviews.text: Whilst the headphones themselves are fine, the Bluetooth experience is substandard. Very poor sound quality due to using an old (and likely cheaper) Bluetooth standard and constancy dropping connections rendering it unresponsive until the you plug into the usb power. Am going to return.
customer_reviews.author: Imski

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: So this is my second pair. For me the sound is great. The seal is great. It's light and comfortable. It would be nice if the battery lasted more than 6 hours on a full charge but it's not a biggie. The wifi can intermittently cut out and sometimes requires reconnecting, once again not so bad. So the reason why this is the second pair is that on the first pair the connection between the cable and the ear piece just began disconnecting meaning I had sound from only one ear. Shure said that they'd look at it it. Couldn't be bothered with all the back and forth so I just bought another pair.
customer_reviews.author: stuartl2

customer_reviews.title: Truly Awful product from Shure
customer_reviews.text: I'm a music producer who has used the wired Shure IEM's for years and love them. I tried the bluetooth set for commuting. The audio quality is awful and the bluetooth is weak. It skips just putting my hand up to my ear or taking my glasses off. The cable is designed to go around your front which is ridiculous. If you put the battery part and cable behind your back as you would expect with this type of design then the volume controls are inaccessible. Do not buy these if you like your music without skipping.
customer_reviews.author: CJG

customer_reviews.title: Flex cable breaks after a few months
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones, I have had them for just under a year now and the battery life does not seem to fade. For the price and size of the headphone, the sound quality is good although sometimes Bluetooth suffers from interference with different devices. They work near perfect on iPhone, though! Major design issue is the flex cable which you loop around your ear to keep the ear phones in place. This snaps after a while and means that it loses all grip on your ear. I had one replacement from Amazon for this issue and I am now experiencing the same with the replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Euan

customer_reviews.title: Third set; that's the family covered.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets of these last year, for my Daughter and her boyfriend (for the gym). They love them. This year I bought a set for my son, again for the gym. Now, whilst they are perfect for gym work, they are a good earphone for many listening experiences. I always check for other views and the one I value the most is "Innerfidelity" (an audiophile website). The SE215 was once in their "Wall of Fame" @ this price range.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Battery like is good
customer_reviews.text: Only supports SBC rather than the much higher quality Apt-X (pretty sure description claimed Apt-X at the time I bought these). Battery like is good, get a good 6 hours out of these. Unfortunately, changed over to a new phone (Huawei P20) and the blue tooth connection is now very jumpy, and constantly skipping. Using these buds with a cable on the other hand is perfect, and great headphones, Avoid the BT version and just buy the wired.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Overrated and expensive for what it has to offer
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good. There is hiss noise when playback starts and it is there constantly. This is probably there by design as maybe audiophiles like that or according to Sure maybe it is because of "inexpensive sound card in your laptop computer" They are quite comfortable and small so they don't bulge out of ears much. When fully charged it works for 6 hours before the next charge. The companion app is quite nice. I think they are just too expensive for what they are.
customer_reviews.author: Yashar

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Had these for around 4 months and they just stopped working. I only use them a few times a week at the gym for one hour each time so longevity is really not good. Amazon is sending a new pair, hope they last a little longer... Sound quality is average but isolation is superb with the supplied memory foam tips. You can still hear around you but nobody will hear what you're listening to no matter how loud it is.
customer_reviews.author: GoGo

customer_reviews.title: Great in ear bluetooth earphones.
customer_reviews.text: These are great in ear buds. has several of the wired versions but these bluetooth ones are great. Perhaps not as good battery life but the usual Shure sound quality - a lit of a delay when watching video on iPad though. (why?) Very comfy in ear, as always.
customer_reviews.author: DaddyTom

customer_reviews.title: Battery issues
customer_reviews.text: These would be the best earphones ever if it wasn't for a very annoying battery issue. It seems to occur when it's cold, even after a full charge and the voice saying there's "more than 6 hours" of battery available, inexplicably the earphones stop working. I managed to get replacement earphones from support but the problem is still there, which makes me think it's some design issue and not a faulty item.
customer_reviews.author: Domenico

customer_reviews.title: Awful Cable
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are great, audio quality is great, bluetooth isnt perfect, but I tend to have my phone close by so im not as worried about that. I returned the first pair after about 2 months of use, due to crackling of one of the headphones, luckily the seller was excellent and sent a replacement pair. about 6 months after this, the SECOND pair had exactly the same issue. Being an audio technician im rather let down by shure with their build quality on this item. My next step is to purchase a new (Not original) bluetooth cable with MMCX, and plug in the driver units into another cable to keep using them.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot Schofield

customer_reviews.title: Good but same price bracket earphones maybe better
customer_reviews.text: I like these earphones, I also have the beats x. The isolation is great, but they do tend to get a bit incomfortable in long sessions and the better life is 6 hours max. I would go for a higher model if budget allows but would love it if shure could Enhance the battery!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Poor Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Have been using the headphones since receiving them Thursday morning and have experienced quite a few connection issues. They seem to lose connectivity intermittently and I need to forget the device in my phone Bluetooth menu and re-pair. The sound keeps intermittently cutting out in the left ear bud, I need to switch them off/on and it comes back. Not what I would expect at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best wireless headphone sub £150
customer_reviews.text: These Shure headphones are amazing. The detail and bass are perfectly balanced for me. These guys have used their professional range experience and made an affordable set of headphones. You would gave to pay a lot more to get anything noticeably better.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: My headphones to date.
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I’ve ever had. I’ve over 10 pairs ranging from seinheisser to Bose through to Grado. My everlasting search for the right pair has come to an end...🤪
customer_reviews.author: Mr Amohm

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what Shure are up to these days. ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what Shure are up to these days. The DAC is dreadful, the ear buds are uncomfortable. I'd price them at around £50.
customer_reviews.author: TommyPete

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great product and I use it with my SE535 so sounds great
customer_reviews.author: DJ Migzy

customer_reviews.title: Poor bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Got mine today and can’t pair them to anything. Briefly paired to iphone but the lost it and can’t get anything since Searching forums suggests lots of others also experiencing similar problem and looks like only thing I can do is return them. Can’t reccomend
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: Unusable Bluetooth Adapter
customer_reviews.text: I am on the second (replacement) item. While the drivers are fine the bluetooth cable/adapter is unusable. It often does not turn on, often the LED keeps glowing red until the battery is depleted, they disconnect randomly, sometimes without cause, sometimes when I press the volume up/down buttons. I had a number of wired Shure headphones and was always happy but these have been a real disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: SWEN-HELGE HUBER

customer_reviews.title: Choose the BT2 cable instead
customer_reviews.text: The headphones themselves are very good as an entry level pair in to the world of Hi-Fi, but stay away from this old and crappy Bluetooth cable from Shure. The BT1 cable is a horrible piece of engineering that should never have been released. Go for the BT2 cable which is much much better with a more powerful and complex DAC.
customer_reviews.author: Amir

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Considering the cost I expected these headphones to be much better. Battery life average at best. They will lose Bluetooth randomly and sound quality is average. Friends and family have far superior Bluetooth headphones within price range.
customer_reviews.author: Vikash Trehan

customer_reviews.title: On my fourth pair
customer_reviews.text: First one would not connect to my phone. Second one would not switch on after 6 months. Third one after 6 months the left earbud kept cutting out. Hopefully more luck with the forth one.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Good, feels like I'm missing something
customer_reviews.text: Hmm. The fact I'm not sold on these after 3 months is the reason for the review. Yes, they sound okay, but only okay for the money. I love them for ease, but for sound? I'm yet to be 110% sold.
customer_reviews.author: Callum Watts

customer_reviews.title: This product is a fake
customer_reviews.text: Was clearly a fake. Bluetooth never connected, logo rubbed off after 1 month, earbuds broke. I ordered off the Shure website in the end as I sent them in after they broke to be looked at. They are amazing earphones, just avoid this stock.
customer_reviews.author: JamesW

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound now with no wires
customer_reviews.text: Great sound just as the wired version is. Coming from the wired version there is no loss of sound quality. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. They break quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped turning on within 4 months and I've looked after them... When they worked they sounded great but I expect a product to last more than 4 months from a company like Shure. Stear clear because I'm not sure I'm the first to have this experience.
customer_reviews.author: P J MOOR

customer_reviews.title: but good sound. Plenty of earpiece options to customise fit
customer_reviews.text: A little more audible lag than I'd prefer, but good sound. Plenty of earpiece options to customise fit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a present & they are very much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: lpagross

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound but problems after 6 mths with BT Connecting
customer_reviews.text: Great Sound but problems after 6 mths with BT Connecting. WTF Can I not return these? They're not 6mths old and are faulty; where is the Return Item of Help TAB on my order???
customer_reviews.author: savagemaher

customer_reviews.title: Good if you know what you're getting.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for the money, good passive canceling but don't expect magic. With the right tips in they are comfortable for hours. I get a full day's work + commute out of them pretty easily
customer_reviews.author: Liam Strong

customer_reviews.title: Don’t fall out my ears.
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones I have trouble getting in ear headphones to stay in my ear. These however have a good selection of buds and the over ear wire makes them fit really snug I also use it as a hands free set when working and have great clarity and sound when on a call.
customer_reviews.author: Adamwhttn

customer_reviews.title: I bought this as the ‘Amazon renew deal’ and it is very great immaculate condition.
customer_reviews.text: Good design, good sound quality and battery life is great
customer_reviews.author: teddictive

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, electronic parts suck
customer_reviews.text: Sound is nice as you'd expect from Shure but it seems they've just bought the cheapest bluetooth module and controller from their Chinese partners. It started going unresponsive after 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: spidamoo

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is excellent and they fit well. They lose a star however as the clothes clip broke on the second use.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S.

customer_reviews.title: Rich bass!
customer_reviews.text: Full frequency response with deep bass brings high enjoyment even when listening with low level.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Cenek

customer_reviews.title: Deep bass
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, deep bass, annoyed that I lost my first pair but happily bought again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not recharge.
customer_reviews.text: Sound is great, however they are not durable. Simply not hold charge and then not work at all. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I tried the cheaper Chinese vertion and while they work well, the battery life was very short and without wanting would drop to critical low in minutes. With these you get an time frame when you turn them on. Very well put together and the sound is just as good as when my se425’s are connected with the cable (if not better due to the battery powering then I can only imagine) If you are debating on these don’t! They are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: thomas mccree

customer_reviews.title: The microphone isn’t the best
customer_reviews.text: Audio is very clear when playing music. The microphone isn’t the best though
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: If you’re used to high end quality like Shure and Etymotic then you will be very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: If you’re used to high end quality like Shure and Etymotic then you will be very disappointed. Stick with the Bose Sounsports for now till Shure clean up their wireless act.
customer_reviews.author: S H Radwan

product_meta.title: Shure SE215-K-BT1-EFS Bluetooth Enabled Sound Isolating Earphones, Black
product_meta.description: Shure SE215-K-BT1-EFS Bluetooth Enabled Sound Isolating Earphones, Black
feature_bullets: Superior sound quality with remarkable isolation derived from decades of developing gear for professional musicians
Integrated microphone and three-button remote ensures clarity for calls and voice prompts, and provides volume and playback control.
The low-profile lightweight design makes the SE215 comfortable to wear
Includes USB charging cable, clothing clip, zippered carrying case and fit kit.

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
specifications.Customer reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
